summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 between FBI personnel discussing approval for a known victim of Jeffrey Epstein to receive therapy sessions. The correspondence confirms the victim's status and addresses issues with Florida's crime victim compensation regulations.

persons.name: M.S., L.M.H.C.
persons.context: A psychotherapist who requests approval for therapy sessions for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Therapy Request for Epstein Victim
events.description: A psychotherapist requests approval for 12 therapy sessions for a known victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Approval for Victim Therapy
events.description: FBI personnel approve a known Epstein victim to receive therapy sessions, noting she lacks access to Florida crime victims compensation.

keyFacts: A known victim of Jeffrey Epstein requested and was approved for therapy sessions in 2020.
The victim was confirmed to have been interviewed by the FBI previously.
The victim faced barriers to accessing crime victim compensation due to Florida's regulations.
The correspondence shows ongoing support for victims years after Epstein's crimes.
Multiple FBI personnel from New York and Washington D.C. offices were involved in the approval process.
